name: Autonomous Payment Dispute Resolution Agent
description: Fully autonomous AI agent that handles end-to-end payment dispute resolution through self-service channels. The agent autonomously processes dispute submissions, applies codified decision matrices, communicates with customers, coordinates with multiple systems (Salesforce, payment processors, vendors), and manages the complete dispute lifecycle including outcome delivery and follow-up. Achieves 95% autonomous resolution without human intervention through sophisticated reasoning and decision-making capabilities.

autonomous_decisions: Apply codified decision matrix rules to determine dispute outcomes
Approve or deny disputes based on evidence and policy
Calculate refund amounts and processing timelines
Communicate decisions and next steps to customers
Coordinate with vendors for chargebacks and clawbacks
Escalate complex cases based on predefined criteria
Update case status and maintain audit trails

autonomous_resolution_approaches: Apply case-based reasoning from historical dispute patterns
Use logical reasoning to interpret complex policy rules
Employ causal analysis to determine dispute root causes
Generate alternative resolution options when standard matrix doesn't apply
Negotiate with vendors through automated communication protocols
reasoning_fallbacks: Conservative decision-making when evidence is ambiguous
Escalation to human specialists for high-value or complex cases
Additional evidence gathering through automated customer outreach
escalation_criteria: Unable to determine outcome after comprehensive analysis
Customer requests human review of agent decision

llm_insights: Agent uses codified decision matrix as primary reasoning framework for consistent outcomes
Multi-system orchestration enables end-to-end automation without human handoffs
Customer communication capabilities allow direct interaction and relationship management
Continuous learning from dispute outcomes improves decision accuracy over time
llm_challenges: Handling edge cases not covered by the codified decision matrix
Managing customer emotions and expectations through automated communication
Coordinating complex multi-party disputes involving customers, vendors, and payment processors
llm_recommended_approach: Deploy autonomous agent with comprehensive access to decision matrix, customer data, and system APIs. Implement sophisticated reasoning capabilities for policy interpretation and exception handling. Use multi-channel communication for customer interaction. Maintain detailed audit trails for compliance and continuous improvement.
